name: Motel 6 Zanesville

reviews.title: Average experience; no issues or problems
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed there in February when in town visiting relatives. The room was clean and comfortable, with nothing to complain about. The room was a little hard to find as the hotel sprawls. The Holidome area was a little dated and worn-looking, but the folks using the pool seemed to be having a very good time.

We had numerous problems on a recent stay here. Our room was given away for part of the trip - the hotel's fix was to smush a roll-away bed and crib into a one king bed room instead of giving us the double/double room which we had reserved. Also, the bathroom was terribly dirty with fixtures hanging off the wall. We had staid here a year prior and it was fine - the place went downhill fast.
reviews.title: Go elsewhere
Great Hotel, Great Price, Stay Here
reviews.text: My family and I spent two nights at the Zanesville Holiday Inn when we were waiting for a car repair during a trip last month. I can't say enough about how accomodating the staff was to our needs. The friendly service was just amazing. More than I would normally expect from a Holiday Inn, and the rooms were a great price as well.I can't really say enough, even the dining room was great, surpassing our expectations once again.If you're travelling through eastern Ohio, you should stay here.

We checked into the Ramada Zanesville after checking out of the horrendously bad Travelodge back a few exits. The Ramada was just what we were hoping for. Clean, comfortable, and cheap accomodations that were close to the highway. We got a nice low AAA rate, and the price certainly met the comfort level. The room was nothing special, just a clean and decent size room wtih double beds. Bathroom had plenty of room with the seperate outside vanity, which is always good when you are traveling with another person. The only down sides I can think of is that it was very hot when we got into the room, and it took about a half hour to cool down. But since we were so exhausted we didnt have much trouble falling asleep anyway.From what I heard they had a decent pool and breakfast, but we were out of there so early that we never got to use any of the ammenities.
reviews.title: Good value...
Needs Renovation
reviews.text: I would advise anyone looking for a just a simple, and affordable hotel near i-70 to stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a very old property. It is a converted Holidome. The exterior corridors have been enclosed. It appeared to be clean but excessive wear and tear on carpet, furniture and etc. The staff acted like they were in a different time zone. Each question was returned by that deer in the head lights look. Not obstinate just unknowing.
reviews.title: All new Ramada on frame of old Holiday Inn

likes.liked: — Really beautiful upgraded facilities - plus indoor pool and hot tub
likes.disliked: — lack of kitchen support staff for breakfast bar

reviews.title: Great experience!!
reviews.text: Some of the old Holidome left over are impressive, pool, lounge and restaurant.
I would stay again but I would know I was getting level two lodging.
reviews.title: Okay, but a better Holiday Inn is in Newark, OH

description: Motel 6 Zanesville is conveniently located near shopping and dining. Visit the antique shops and historic building like the Muskingum Courthouse. Enjoy free WiFi in all guest rooms and microfridge in select rooms.
